com.pb.sawdust.util.concurrent

Class ForkJoinPoolFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPoolFactory

  • public class ForkJoinPoolFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    The ForkJoinPoolFactory class provides a simple factory for getting ForkJoinPools. The factory caches the pools it returns, so that any requests for identically sized pools should generally return the previously constructed pool. The intention of this class is that it will be used to recycle a handful (at most) of pools; generally speaking, only a few differently sized pools should be needed (depending on the application) and their resources should be shared amongst applications. The internal caching employed by this class limits its references to too many pool threads so asking for many differently-sized pools can actually lead to an explosion in thread creation and a severe reduction in sharing of resources.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool getForkJoinPool()
      Get a fork join pool using a default number of threads (usually number of cores/processors).

      Get a fork join pool using a specified number of threads.
